snippet.title: Coast surfers claim top honours at Australian Surf Festival
snippet.content:
SURFING: Sunshine Coast surfing talent was among several newly crowned national champions following the Australian Surf Festival. Mooloolah Valley's Les Aberley and Noosaville's David Cousins dominated the four-foot waves at Duranbah Beach in New South Wales yesterday to be awarded Australian Surfmasters Champions. Aberley surfed well in the Over-55 Men's class to score 14.75 in the final while Cousins hit the surf in the Over-60 Men's division and put in a score of 15.15 for the win. The duo weren't the only Coast surfers in the festival's finals, with Coolum's Jye Gofton claiming a third placing in the Over-40 Men's with a score of 12.80 and fellow Coolum surfer Paul Wayland making an impression with a score of 13.25 to claim third in the Over-45 Men's division. -On the international stage, Sunshine Coast surfer Keely Andrew has been knocked out of the Championship Tour's Vans US Open of Surfing at Huntington Beach in California. Andrew was defeated by Sally Fitzgibbons in round one, heat four of the event and was eliminated by Silvana Lima in round two, heat one.
